headline: Classic Peanut Butter Cookies
description: These peanut butter cookies are absolutely delicious and easy to make with crunchy peanut butter for a crowd-pleasing treat any day of the week!

video.description: See how to make top-rated peanut butter cookies.
video.name: Classic Peanut Butter Cookies

name: Classic Peanut Butter Cookies

recipeInstructions.text: Beat butter, peanut butter, white sugar, and brown sugar with an electric mixer in a large bowl until smooth; beat in eggs.
Sift flour, baking soda, baking powder, and salt into a separate bowl; stir into butter mixture until dough is just combined. Chill cookie dough in the refrigerator for 1 hour.
Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
Roll dough into 1-inch balls and place 2 inches apart onto ungreased baking sheets. Flatten each ball with a fork, making a crisscross pattern.
Bake in the preheated oven until edges are golden, about 10 minutes. Cool on the baking sheets briefly before removing to a wire rack to cool completely.

review.reviewBody: I had never made these cookies before. These came out fantastic. I had to make more because my 'taste testers' ate the first batch! thanks for a great recipe!

These cookies were so hard it felt like they were tearing up the inside of my mouth. They looked great, tasted ok but actually hurt my mouth to eat them. I am guessing the baking time was too long, but I sure won't be making them again.
I used Honey Peanut Butter Creamy added a 1/2 cup more and 1/4 cup more flour Delicious
great recipe!!

Worst recipe ever. 375 for 10 min were black hockey pucks. Even at 325 for 6 minutes they were black on the bottom. I checked my oven temperature and it is spot on. Too much sugar and peanut butter and butter ratio is way off if you like a strong peanut butter taste.

If anyone you know has a peanut allergy, this recipe works very well with other nut butters. I find the cookies are exceptional with Nuts For Nature nut & seed butter (almonds, cashews, chia seeds, hazelnuts, sunflower seeds and Brazil nuts) from Costco. We triple the recipe, (except the dough is stiff enough at 6.25 cups of flour), and add an entire 737 gram (about 26 oz) jar of the Nuts For Nature. Now I can't imagine using plain old peanut butter. I just hope Costco keeps selling this stuff.
Awful! Too soft and tasteless.
Amazing recipe!‚≠êÔ∏è

They are more like peanut butter flavored sugar cookies. Also, after I flatten them with forks, the cookies spread so much and came out very thin. If you are looking for thick, dense peanut butter cookies, these are not it.
love these!

The recipe came together easily. I used natural crunchy peanut butter (so no added sugar) and I feel that tempered the sugar nicely. I also added more than 1 C of peanut butter - more like 1&1/3C- not as strategic baking move but because I just wanted to finish off the jar. They came out great! They aren‚Äôt what I would call crunchy but they are light and crisp. I think next time I may use extra crunchy PB or maybe add in some chopped peanuts just for added crunch and peanut flavor as a personal preference. Otherwise great recipe - thank you!
Less sugar and more peanut butter is what this recipe needs. I won‚Äôt be making this one again. Not enough peanut butter flavor
Recipe was easy and simple, I love it and this is my 3rd time making it so I added semisweet chocolate chips
I liked the recipe. I did add 1 teaspoon of v anilla.
Great Recipe. Turned out Amazing ü§©ü§©
No did as directions stated. They were just as good as my mom's were.
Excellent recipe! I reduced the quantity by 1/2 since I‚Äôm a single man. I froze all but three cookies baked as per instructions they came out perfect and delicious. Thank you Shirley.
I added some vanilla and cookies were Delicious!!
Very mild peanut butter flavor, soft cookie. I embellished it by making sandwich cookies with raspberry jelly. Also, made a batch with chocolate chips and one with butterscotch chips.
I MADE THE RECIPIE EXACT AND CAME OUT SO YUMMY!
I like the cookies flavor but the peanut butter taste was lost during baking, and the cookie was crumbly when you bit into it. And the after taste was a lil bit salty

‚Ä¢	1 cup unsalted butter‚Ä¶or 1 cup salted, omit salt below ‚Ä¢	1 cup crunchy peanut butter + ¬Ω cup creamy peanut butter ‚Ä¢	1 cup white sugar ( if rolling in sugar ‚Äì ¬º c) ‚Ä¢	1 cup brown sugar ( if packing down -2 TB, otherwise too sweet) ‚Ä¢	1 t vanilla ‚Ä¢	2 large eggs ‚Ä¢	2 ¬æ cups all-purpose flour ‚Ä¶or if using other flours (wheat, whole white) -2 TB ‚Ä¢	1 teaspoon baking soda ‚Ä¢	1 teaspoon baking powder ‚Ä¢	¬Ω teaspoon salt ( using salted butter, omit or add 1/4t ) ‚Ä¢	¬Ω t cinnamon or cardamon powder I line my baking sheet with parchment paper. Do 4 test cookies first. Cook 350. 11-12 mins. even if slightly doughy, they will be perfect to sit for 5 mins before placing on a rack. Doing test cookies allows you to make adjustments for the cooking time; should I roll dough in sugar or not, should I press with fork or not. I am not a fan of rolling cookie dough balls in sugar before cooking. I may try sprinkling after they come out of oven before they cool down. Or dusting them with powder sugar for something different. After reading reviews, I made these adjustments above in the ingredient list. Enjoy. I will try again.

This recipe is very close to the recipe my Canadian flatmate taught me about 40 years ago! Only recipe I ever remembered that was in cups not weights. However I would definitely cut down on the sugar quantity. Just too sweet. Cannot for the life of me understand people suggesting dredging these cookies in sugar before baking! Totally agree however with adding vanilla. Also the instructions are too complex. Just throw everything in the bowl, beat well with a wooden spoon. Spoon out onto the tray and press down with a wet fork. No need for complicated equipment or adding the ingredients in any particular order!

I loved this recipe. I made a couple changes. First, I rolled the cookies in sugar before pressing them. It gave them a nice texture and made them just a little sweeter. Second I put my pizza stone on the rack under it to help regulate the oven temp. My cookies consistently came out perfect at 9 minutes. My batch yielded about 60 cookies. I had some left over melting chocolate and drizzled it over some.
I did roll the balls around in a little bit of sugar other than that and made it as directed I thought I turned out good I would make them again

OH my.... This will be my 'Go To' recipe from now on! They came out thin and crumbly, just the way I like them. The only changes I made was to roll the balls in dredging sugar before criss-crossing with a fork. I also added a teaspoon of vanilla.
This is a very easy recipe and the cookies came out great.
Would need to add more peanut butter next time and mine burned on the bottom on 10 minute bake time..
Perfect‚Ä¶. Based on other comments I made sure to sift measure my flour. They turned out great!
Didn't change a thing (maybe 1 min longer in the oven :) Turned out crispy and delish!!! Finished results 1/4" thick. I used Kraft Smooth PB.
Yum! I read the reviews and went with one of there add ons to the recipe like half cup more of peanut butter and little more flower and sugar on top so yah yum
Made them exactly like the recipe and thought they were bland. Maybe they needed more peanut butter.

This really easy I always like adding Reese's chip and Hersey chocolate chip too ,very delicious,make them easy to do make sure you let them cool down before moving them off onto a tray everyone likes them ; way better than bought cookies cause you know these are made with ‚ù§Ô∏è
Perfect wouldn‚Äôt change anything ‚ù§Ô∏è
Perfect balance of ingredients. Easy to make.

This a great recipe and very simple to make. I added two Tbs of ground cinnamon to the dry ingredients, other than that I followed the recipe exactly. Everyone loved them !!! Definitely added to my files......

These are good, straight-forward PB cookies, although I feel they came out a little flat, even though I chilled the dough. Next time I'll use an extra tablespoon or so of flour. I *did* use creamy PB, maybe the chunky kind wouldn't be so flat? And don't blast me for changing the recipe and knocking off a star! The recipe clearly says you can sub creamy PB for chunky.
I made each dough ball 16-17 grams and came out with 75 cookies. The cookies were each 2.75" in diameter when done.
I bake the cookies exactly how the recipe says and I loved üòç thank you so much.

2 sticks of butter is NOT the same as 1 cup of butter (113 grams vs 226 grams) - this recipe would be so much better if it was provided in grams only. Just put a container on a scale and add all the ingredients one after another, TAREing in between - no squeezing butter or peanut butter into a cup.

if I'm being honest I had to change a lot of things on this recipe it's not really their recipe anymore, If I have to change that much It's not that good, but if I had to guess I'd say u just guessed on it, It's not good.
Soft middle, crisp edges. Used creamy peanut butter.
No changes. These cookies were so dry they fell apart. Could not eat them.

Simple, easy to follow recipe that produces a good cookie. I substitute smooth peanut butter and turn them into sandwich cookies by making a layer of 50:50 peanut butter and icing in the middle of two cookies.
I thought it was the best thing I ever made and so did everyone I shared them with.
These were fowl! The dough turned to mush in the oven and came out like flat flavorless muffins than cookies.

after reading other reviews i literally doubled the peanut butter in these cookies. they came out perfect! my family loves peanut butter and i couldn‚Äôt have these tasting plain. i make these in a big batch, roll them into balls, and freeze in a gallon ziplock bag for easy cookie making whenever my family is craving. just double the peanut butter.

We used up some failed hazelnut spread in place of the peanut butter, (1lb of hazel nuts, 3 tbs special dark cocoa, + splash of light cream)+2 cups total (fake sugar )6tbs truvia+ 10 tbs swerve. (Which in total is supposedly sweeter than sugar) and GF 1 for 1 flour. The cookies seemed greasy (when raw) but where dry in the end, and not very sweet, we decided they would be good with frosting. Kids ate them. I'd definitely siguest more sugar if using the gf flour ( nature's promise)and making them for kids., if not frosting them. I think an adult, may enjoy them as a light snack, as is they where maybe a bit less sweet than a regular gram cracker. Happy to use up my messed up speadüòÅ seems like they could be rolled if you'd want to do such a thing.
They were not peanut butter tasting more like shortbread.

I made these with gluten free flour, so m expectations were low. I am not an experienced baker by any means. I added semi sweet chocolate chips. As I altered the recipe significantly I can only speak to the batch I made. Cookies were a bit cakey. The recipe made two dozen cookies.
So good
Very bland.
Delicious peanut butter cookies made with natural peanut butter and its oils.üòò
Made this recipe with a few alterations. Added a bag of semi sweet choc chips and I cooked them for a minute longer.

after seeing the comment about not tasting enough peanut butter, (as a peanut butter lover, i couldn‚Äôt have that) i added an extra cup of peanut butter (a whole jar) and a tiny bit extra salt, it made these cookies amazing!
Easy recipe and taste yummy!
Love this Recipe!! Our family Favorite!! We don't mark with a fork so they're crispy on the edges & soft in the middle!

I made the recipe as is, except that I used salted butter and omitted the 1/2 teaspoon of salt. As for the results of Porsche09, I did not experience that result. I found them to bake and taste just like the homemade peanut butter cookies that my sister and me used to make when we were children. I think the sugar amounts provided the correct amount of sweetness to compliment the perfectly peanut flavor. Anymore sugar would risk a hyperglycemic coma. The peanut aroma filled the house and drove my dog nearly crazy, as she loves peanut butter dog treats.

This is an awesome recipe! I followed it as is to make the cookie then tossed in a handful each of peanut butter chips and skor toffee bits. I gently pressed my fork to flatten raw cookies a tiny bit, then sprinkled with white sugar and baked at 350 for 11 min. The pb chips and toffee bits beautifully melted into the cookie, they were soft and delicious!
It was easy and tasty according to the person I made the cookies for.

I have made these so many times and they always disappear so fast!! I use less salt than required as the peanut butter has enough salt already. Also, I‚Äôve never once refrigerated this dough - because who has time for that - and it always turns out amazing. My family also requests chocolate chips in theirs and they make them even better!
Delicious! I was not a huge fan of peanutbutter cookies until my daughter made these. Perfect.

Because butter is expensive and getting hard to get ,I used butter flavored crisco. Yum. I have used this before and it is really good I used a #2 cookie scoop and sugar on the fork to make crisscrosses.
I‚Äôve tried a lot of peanut butter cookie recipes. This takes the best taste and good look. My family loved them and so do I.
so good for the family and friends
They look delicious I‚Äôm just hoping they are
I used powdered sugar cause that‚Äôs all we had. In the oven now!

The cookies' flavors were on point. I managed to mess up and burn them, had I not done that, the flavors would've come through much easier, but that is just human error. Definitely going to try this one again, and maybe not forget to check the cookies every few minutes (our oven is a bit slow so we have to cook things longer)
Very easy to make up and you have enough cookies to share with friends. They taste Great!

I really liked how these turned out. I did add a teaspoon of vanilla, and salted margarine. Next time I will do them with salted butter and not add the salt. I dropped them with a 1/2 tablespoon and put in the air fryer for about 8 1/2 minutes each little tray which I got a dozen on each. I will make these again using this recipe.

After reading the reviews and taking their advice (increasing the peanut butter and flour amounts), I can honestly say that this recipe is a huge hit! Just the right taste, texture and size for the perfect peanut butter cookie! All that I need now is a big glass of ice cold milk!
Add some vanilla for an even more wonderful taste, if you like it. Try it again with the amount you like‚Ä¶wow!
I used vegan butter and replaced the eggs with a banana üçå They are soft and chewy and so delicious! This is now my favorite peanut butter cookie recipe (modified to be vegan of course)
Really enjoyed this recipe! Was looking for that classic peanut butter taste from when I was young. This recipe hit the mark. Delicious and perfectly sweet.

It‚Äôs delicious! I sprinkled cinnamon and white sugar overtop after they were done baking! I bake for a living and I will tell you, though these cookies did not turn out pretty. They were freaking delicious.
Well I used both creamy and crunchy peanut butter! I loved how it had a slight crunch but not all crunchy!
I made the cookies and they tasted really good
Not only were the cookies a beautiful brown crispy edge sweet buttery peanut butter Can‚Äôt wait to eat tasting. . It was wonderful to eat it
They didn‚Äôt spread out as much as I‚Äôd like but good taste.
Perfect
I like Peanut butter Cookies..This although modified a little...recipe is outstanding!‚òëÔ∏è
Easy and delicious!

instead of sheets and fork imprints we baked them in cupcake tins and put a thumb print in them and filled the print with chocolate chips(which melted on the hot cookies.). we think this way works really good and tastes even better. But the cookies themselves were also really good without the chocolate we just think it adds an extra (nice) touch.-written by: Nevaeh (i'm 11)
I put chocolate chips easy recipe to follow
Had to try it immediately! Soft center on mine. Next batch in the oven and I will let it go a little longer for a different texture.
Recommend sub butter for THC butter and then you're making peanut butter bombers!
It is really good I make it all the time!
Easy and delicious!
Fabulous
These are absolutely the best.
Yummy, nice and soft, used smooth peanut butter and rolled in sugar before making crisis cross pattern. Thus is a keeper!

Total mess from start to finish and to add insult to injury, didn't even taste that good. First, you need to rest the dough a LOT longer than 1 hour in the fridge. After I took out of the fridge and saw the dough was still too sticky to use, I put it into the freezer for 15 minutes. Still too sticky, but I went ahead anyhow. Forget about making those pretty cross hatch marks, the dough sticks to the fork. When I took the first batch out and moved them to a cooling rack, half of them fell apart. Baking the 2nd batch for 15, will see if that helps. Very disappointed with this recipe.

This recipe is amazing! Actually, I made a mistake, forgot to put the eggs. It‚Äôs came out even better. Absolutely recommend this recipe with or without eggs. P.S. After flour I added 1 cup of chocolate chips.

I followed the recipe exactly as it says. I didn‚Äôt have a hand mixer so I used the good old hand whisk. I made the cookie dough balls about 1‚Äù-1.5‚Äù and came out to about almost 8 dozen cookies. They are delicious! I recommend!
I added a little extra peanut butter and a little extra flour because of your other reviews, Perfect!!!!!!!

I did roll the dough balls in sugar first and pressed with a fork. I did not make any other changes to this recipe. And it made about 4 dozen cookies. LOVE IT. My oven is electric and living at 6,300 ft altitude I adjusted the temperature to 325deg F and baked for 11-1/2 minutes.
Made half the recipe. Cannot eat that many. They taste great.
Incredible!

Wonderful and so crisp. Liked having the dough in the fridge. I added one forth cup of almond butter to the peanut butter and also added more peanut butter. I rolled each ball in sugar with a little raw sugar. Also added chopped walnuts. Baked 15 minutes.
